intro: Iris bifurca, commonly known as the bifurcate iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with sword-shaped leaves that are narrow and pointed. Its flowers consist of three upright petals and three downward-curving sepals, forming a distinctive shape. Iris bifurca thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays.
